Description: Terracotta figure or figure plaque fragment. Fragment of fluted column base only. Mould-made. Traces of white coating. Red-brown (Nile?) silt with sand inclusions.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Naukratis parallels include a scene with Eros, dated 1st century BC (Munich, Bavarian State Collection of Antiques 5298). See also imported plaque dated 3rd to 1st century BC (Cambridge, Museum of Classical Archaeology NA376).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.233) (Phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4626 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
